message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with visual question answering (VQA) and leverages transformer-based cross-modality encoders to train visual-linguistic representations for the task. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper deals with information retrieval (cs.IR) and multimedia (cs.MM) aspects, as it uses text associated with ads and Wikipedia pages on brands, as well as ad images, to recommend themes for ad creative design. Finally, the paper proposes a theme recommender system based on machine learning techniques, which falls under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category.
